Question: why might older engineers struggle more with adopting new technologies compared to younger engineers?
Answer: Older engineers may struggle more with adopting new technologies due to a combination of factors: 1) **Cognitive Rigidity**: Long-established habits and ways of thinking can make it harder to adapt to new methods. 2) **Technological Gap**: A longer career span means more time spent on older technologies, reducing exposure to newer ones. 3) **Learning Styles**: Older individuals often prefer hands-on learning and may find digital tutorials less engaging. 4) **Fear of Obsolescence**: Concerns about job security can create resistance to adopting unfamiliar tools.
